Bastian Schweinsteiger has joined the Chicago Fire in the MLS after a nightmare spell at Manchester United. 
And there is often a bit of confusion over how the American top flight works, among people who don't follow it regularly. 
You see, they have a league table and everyone plays each other twice just like everywhere else. 
But at the end of the season the top team doesn't won the league, oh no. They Top eight teams all go into a playoff to see who actually gets the silverware. 
Oh and the trophy is then called the 'MLS Cup' just to add confusion. 
Which might be why one reporter at Schweinsteiger's unveiling at Chicago Fire got super confused and asked the German World Cup winner... ...if Chicago Fire can win the World Cup. 
The former Bayern Munich midfielder looked confused, asked if he'd just heard what he thought he'd heard and struggled to come up with an answer. 
So the reporter tried again...and basically got even more confused. 
It took the club's General Manager Nelson Rodriguez to step in and remind everyone that Chicago Fire won't be trying to win the World Cup anytime soon. Oops! Can Chicago Fire win the World Cup? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
